intro: Nothopanax anisum, commonly known as the Indian sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with opposite arrangement. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ethnobotanical studies.
